p: Wild marine species showed to contain higher ω3 PUFA levels compared to farmed ones, likely due to the feed composition [ 153]. Some vegetables can supply both the essential PUFA and some derivative fatty acids. Particularly, the oils obtained from the seeds of Borago spp., Echium spp., Ranunculus spp. and Oenothera biennis L. have been reported to contain high levels of both LA and γ-linolenic acid (GLA) [ 159, 160].
